procedure.title: To log into the @@ProductName@@
procedure.para: Ensure that you have the required permissions to carry out the tasks.

step.para: Launch the URL of the Customer Service Console from a web browser.

footnote.para:
where:
mgdhost.mycompany.com is the address of a load balancer that fronts the cluster of Managed Servers or the host on which a Managed Server instance is installed.
8001 is the clear port.
8002 is the SSL port.

step.para: Enter the User Name and Password in the fields provided on the Customer Service Console login page. Click Log On.

If a customer service representative (CSR) logs in using the ONT address as Custom Field and default as Subscriber ID , the CSR can run tests and workflows on the ONT address. The Subscriber Account Information table from the Subscriber tab will not be available because the subscriber information is not present.

The console validates the entered information. If valid, the console runs the startup tests and displays a new session of the @@ProductName@@. The following four tabs are displayed:
Dashboard: Displays the current status of FTTx connection. The following details are displayed on the dashboard:
Overall health check for FTTx connection and QoS
The startup diagnosis results containing the issues that are detected
FTTx account information
Troubleshooting workflow
Subscriber - Displays the following:
Subscriber Account Information
Account Services
FTTx Service Quality Information
FTTx Service Quality History
Detected Issues and Recommendations
Diagnostics: Displays the following:
Bandwidth report
Link diagnostics
Link quality history
PON quality validation
Power validation
Account Activity - Displays the history of tests sessions run for this subscriber. The current session is displayed at the top of the tree list and is expanded, showing the three first tests run at login.
Workflow: Displays a guided troubleshooting for FTTx that:
Detects fiber connectivity issues, ONT OFF, and optical quality degradation
Provides guided recommendation to subscriber and guided escalation decision.
Network Map: Displays the items through which the subscriber is connected to the network, and the status of each item as detected by the optical QoS test.
The actual network map displayed depends on the data provided by the topology integration.

section.title: Managing elements in the console window
section.para: Click the following icons in the Title bar to execute the described operations.

listitem.para: Click Session Log to open a blank area where you can note any information you want to log for this session. The log is saved (if not empty) when the session ends.
Click Alerts to display the list of current alerts.
Click End Session to save the results (and the log if not empty) and return to the console user login page.
Click Help to open the Online Help of the @@ProductName@@.
